Sentencas: The broad and widespread commercialisation of solid oxide fuel cells still requires a lot of research and devel-opment.
Titulo: An interfacial study between SrZr0.85Cu0.15O3-d and barium oxide-containing borosilicate glass sealant for solid oxide fuel cell application

Sentencas: Since the fuel cell consists of several components, compatibility of these components is necessary.
Titulo: An interfacial study between SrZr0.85Cu0.15O3-d and barium oxide-containing borosilicate glass sealant for solid oxide fuel cell application

Sentencas: Because structural, thermal or chemical changes in any of the cell components affect the overall working of the cell.
Titulo: An interfacial study between SrZr0.85Cu0.15O3-d and barium oxide-containing borosilicate glass sealant for solid oxide fuel cell application

Sentencas: In the present work, perovskite structured SrZr0.85Cu0.15O3-delta (cathode) and a glass sealant, 45SiO2-40BaO-10B2O3-5ZrO2, are mixed in the ratio of 70:30 wt %, respectively and heat-treated at 800 C for 1, 10, 100 and 500 h in the air.
Titulo: An interfacial study between SrZr0.85Cu0.15O3-d and barium oxide-containing borosilicate glass sealant for solid oxide fuel cell application

Sentencas: The X-ray diffraction results show the presence of some minor amounts of detrimental phases, i.e. BaSrSi2O6 and SiO2.
Titulo: An interfacial study between SrZr0.85Cu0.15O3-d and barium oxide-containing borosilicate glass sealant for solid oxide fuel cell application

Sentencas: However, the presence of these phases is minute compared to the major crystalline phase (SrZrO3).
Titulo: An interfacial study between SrZr0.85Cu0.15O3-d and barium oxide-containing borosilicate glass sealant for solid oxide fuel cell application

Sentencas: Grain size increases with increasing heat-treatment duration with a well-connected cathode-sealant interface.
Titulo: An interfacial study between SrZr0.85Cu0.15O3-d and barium oxide-containing borosilicate glass sealant for solid oxide fuel cell application

Sentencas: The coefficient of thermal expansion is in the required range as pre-scribed for solid oxide fuel cells even after 500 h of heat treatment of the diffusion couple at 800 C.
Titulo: An interfacial study between SrZr0.85Cu0.15O3-d and barium oxide-containing borosilicate glass sealant for solid oxide fuel cell application
